lines.line: Nilsal, my child. Your arrival is well timed.
It is?
Yes. The Queen would like to speak with you.
Now?
Indeed. She is waiting for you upstairs. I will go on ahead and let her know you are here.
I am told you were with my son when he was captured?
Yes, my Queen.
You followed along with this plan of his, knowing that in doing so, you were supporting him in disobeying an order from his Queen?
You do not strike me as a fool, so why do you play the part of one?
I can fix this. I promise you, I will find Itzla and I will rescue him.
Why should I trust you? Because my son did? Tell me, which recent event was it that suggested to you that he was of sound judgement?
With respect, my Queen, were it not for here, I would have died at the hands of the Emissaries. I believe earned our trust.
Trust is like a blade. If not maintained, it fails when you need it most.
Then let us give our iknami here the opportunity to regain our trust.
Hmm...
You seem to have made quite the impression, outsider. Both Servius and my son have taken a liking to you.
Prove them right. Rectify this situation.
I will. Where should I begin?
We need to avoid outright aggression. The safety of my son cannot be risked. I understand you were able to infiltrate the Emissaries and gain access to their temple?
That's right.
Then do so again. Gather any information you can on what they are doing with my son, then return to me here. Do not give me a reason to regret this decision.
I won't let you down. You have my word.
Good luck, my child. May the sun light your way.
I just need to do something else first, but I'll be back soon.
Don't take too long. The Queen doesn't like to be kept waiting.
The Queen is waiting, my child. Let us go and speak with her.
Nilsal, my child. I wish you luck at the Twilight Temple.
Thank you. We'll have Itzla back soon. I promise.
You have the dedication of a true servant of Ralos. Keep safe, my child.
You have a job to do. Return to the Twilight Temple and uncover any information you may have missed when you were last there.
I'll go right away.
Good. Don't let me down.
Hey! You don't have permission to go in there!
... and with the guidance of Ralos and Ranul, who stand beside us in our fight, we will be victorious!
I know recent setbacks have you questioning. I know you have concerns. You need not whisper them in the shadows, for you are free to question. More than that, you are encouraged to question!
After all, was it not your questions that brought you here? Did you not dare to ask them while others shied away in fear?
Remember this: We are the doubters! We are the outcasts! Society shunned us for it, but only those who question everything will ever find the truth.
And that truth? That is what we fight for. That is what will bring about the Final Dawn!
Let me now assure you, these setbacks have done nothing to stop us! The road to Mokhaiotl is clearer than ever! We have no need for the Teokan any more!
Bring out the prisoner!
See how the rulers of this kingdom are powerless against us. Itzla Arkan, heir to the throne of Varlamore, is now our prisoner!
You love it, don't you? Standing on a stage spouting nonsense to a bunch of fanatics! It means nothing, Metzli!
People like you always fear the truth. Do you know why? Because without your lies, all that you do, all that you live for, is meaningless.
But your fear, it can now end. Here, you finally have a purpose. Here, you can finally serve Ralos and Ranul.
Do you not see? The blood of the Teokan runs through your veins. You are now the key to the Final Dawn!
You want my blood? Take it! Just make sure you take it all! At least that way I won't have to listen to the garbage you spew any more!
Listen to the anger in his voice. It is a poor attempt to mask his fear. We need not fear though, for our purpose is clear.
Go now, for time is short, and there is much left to do. It will soon be time to deliver Twilight's Promise. It will soon be time for the Final Dawn!
Hmm... They brought Itzla in from downstairs...
The people of this world do not have the strength to do what must be done. Ximoua will only come to be if we make it so.
Greetings, friend. Our time grows ever near. Ralos and Ranul will unite us all as one, and we will create a new world.
It is an honour to serve the Augur. She will lead us to Mokhaiotl.
The Final Dawn approaches, friend. We will deliver Twilight's Promise.
I can't let you down there without the passphrase.
Er...
Umm...
Nice try. Only those worthy to know the passphrase may enter.
Correct!
Oh, that was it?
That's right. Go right ahead.
There must be something useful here...
Let's see...
Uh oh...
... not to mention what happens when the Queen sends her forces to recover the Prince.
The Queen will not dare put her son in danger. Your worries are unfounded. Besides, I've already made arrangements for him to be moved elsewhere.
Unfounded? Do you not see how risky this plan is? We should have stuck with Servius rather than revealing ourselves.

And if the opportunity presents itself, Servius will still make for a valid option. The trick here isn't to have one plan, it's to have many. We have enough options available that one of them will bear fruit.
It won't matter how many options we have if we don't live long enough to see them through. You keep gambling with our future here!
You should have more faith, Furia. Look at your brother. He's a true believer now.
A fool is what he is.
Good job we have many uses for fools then...
That was close...
Ah...
What is this? No one is allowed in here!
Give me that!
There's only one outcome for betraying the Augur...
Death.
You've returned. I trust that means you have news for us?
I do. Itzla was being held at the temple, but they've now moved him elsewhere.
Where?
I don't know, but I did also find out that they have some sort of plan for him. They called him the key to the Final Dawn. Something to do with him having Servius' blood.
My blood? Do they wish to trigger the Gathering?
The Gathering? What's the Gathering?
What it is isn't important right now. Do not lose focus on the matter at hand. If you don't know where they took my son, then how do you intend to find out?
I discovered that Forebearer Janus, a senior member of the Emissaries, is living right here in Fortis in a cult safe house. I was thinking we could capture him and find out what he knows.
Where is this safe house?
Directly opposite a bank apparently.
Well, there are no houses opposite the eastern bank, so it must be the one looking over the western bank.

Then let's not waste any time. Adventurer, I will dispatch Captain Vibia of the Knights of Varlamore to this property. You will meet her there. Secure the property with her and capture this Forebearer Janus.
I'll head over there at once.
Good. May the sun light your way.
Nilsal, my child. The Queen has given you a job to do. I suggest you get going. Keep safe out there.
Adventurer, you should head to this cultist property near the western bank. Captain Vibia will meet you there.
I'll head over at once.
Good, you're here. Shall we get started?
I guess so...
I've been observing the property and it doesn't seem anyone is home. At least, not any people...
People? Meaning...
Dogs. There's one outside and at least one more in the house. I don't expect them to take kindly to intruders.
So what's our plan?
We will secure the house and prepare a trap to capture this cultist leader upon their return. As we don't know exactly when that will be, I suggest we move quickly.
First up, we need a way inside. I will keep watch out here while you find us that way in.
Okay, I'll get to work.
We're wasting time here. You need to find a way into this house.
That cultist could be back at any time. What's the hold up?
I've found a way into the house, but there's a locked door I need to get past. I'll have it open soon.
Good. Best you get back to it then.
Good work. Now that the property is secure, we need to prepare for the return of this Forebearer Janus. I trust you brought supplies?
Er... What kind of supplies?
First, we'll need a way to restrain him.
Hmm... I don't think I have anything suitable on me.
Well, what about something to knock him out with?
I don't think I have anything for that either. Shall I head out and gather some things?
No. This cultist could be back at any moment and we need to make sure we're here when he does. Let's have a look around and see if there's anything in the house we can use instead.
So you're a Knight of Varlamore?
I am. What of it?
That makes Itzla your boss, right?
He is the leader of the Knights of Varlamore, though I am currently filling that role in his absense.
What do you think of this whole situation with him?
I think we have a job to do, and I think we should get on with it rather than making small talk.
Fair enough.
I'll get searching.
Reckon we can use this?
Hmm... I guess we could use this to restrain him, but I reckon we'll instead want something that can cover his head as well.
No. I think that sack you gave me will be better for restraining him with.
That thing looks brutal! We don't want to kill him!
You mean this thing could kill a person?
Quite possibily !
Oh... I didn't know that.
That thing looks brutal! We don't want to kill him! Maybe you should use that other one you made instead.
Yes, I think I can use this to restrain him with. I'll keep a hold of it.
Hmm... Not on its own, I don't think.
I made this from a few things I found.
Perfect! You keep a hold of that and use it to subdue him when the time comes.
I think we have everything we need now.
I believe you're right. Now just to wait for him to return home...
Hey, look! I'm a distraction!
What the...
Hey! Get this thing off me!
Whack him!
I've found the basement key.
Good. Down there will work nicely for interrogation. You get him ready. I'll fetch the Queen...
The Queen herself? Such an honour. Don't think for one second that I'm going to tell you anything though. Even death itself doesn't scare me.
Really? I've known a lot of people claim death doesn't scare them. From afar, bravery comes easy, but then the moment finally comes when they stare death in the face...
That's when they break. If you think you're the exception, you will soon be disappointed.
Ha! You are out of touch, my Queen. I am a herald of the Final Dawn! For us, death is a glory to be celebrated!
Then celebrate it you will, but first, you will talk.
Leave me with him. Alone.
What happened?
He talked.
It seems you were right Servius, the cultists wish to trigger the Gathering.
Sorry, but could someone explain what the Gathering is to me?
It's the ceremony where a dead Teokan is laid to rest and their successor is chosen.
But why is it so important to the cultists?

According to our recently departed iknami here, it's less about the ceremony and more about its location: The Crypt of Tonali, in the Tlati Rainforest. The cult believe the crypt houses the secret path to Mokhaiotl.
The Tlati Rainforest? Just like the nagua said...
Yes, Servius mentioned this nagua you encountered. What did she say?
Not much. She just referred to Mokhaiotl as the Tlati archive.
We should be weary of trusting the words of a nagua, my Queen.
Perhaps, though it matters little whether we believe her or not. The cult do believe, and they will stop at nothing to access the crypt.
So what do we do now?
The Gathering takes place behind a set of doors within the crypt. These doors can only be opened with the blood of the two Teokan.
The cult are hoping to substitute Servius' blood with my son's, but it seems they are having issues in doing so. They have apparently chosen to seek help from the Dwarves of Cam Torum with this.
Why the dwarves?
The crypt is the most holiest of places, built by the Old Ones themselves. However, the doors were a more recent addition, built by the dwarves. This was before relations soured between us...
I see. So, to Cam Torum then?
To Cam Torum. Oh, and...
You did well here. It seems Itzla was right to trust you.
Thank you, my Queen.
Now, we will depart at once. Are you ready to go?
Yes, let's go.
I'll make my own way there.
Very well, but let me know if you change your mind.
, do you wish to travel with us to Cam Torum?
Nilsal, my child. We will soon be heading to Cam Torum. You should speak with the Queen if you wish to join us.
I hear you're heading to Cam Torum. You should not waste time.
Are you not joining us?
No. I am to head to the Tlati Rainforest and ensure we have suitable defences around the Crypt of Tonali.
Makes sense. In that case, good luck.
And to you, adventurer. May the sun light your way.
Zyanyi Arkan. What an unexpected surprise. Your business here must be very important for you to have not sent prior word of your coming.
I'm afraid the suddenness of our arrival was a necessity, though I'm pleased to see that it didn't prevent you from meeting us here personally, Highlord Katlo.
Well, what kind of ruler would I be if I didn't make sure to treat our honoured allies with the highest of respect?
How very true.
I heard about the unfortunate events at the Teomat, but it is good to see the Teokan has made a full recovery. No doubt those responsible met swift justice?
Their days are numbered.
So they are still at large? How concerning. Still, I'm sure your son and his knights will be doing all they can to rectify that.
Perhaps, Highlord, we should discuss the reason for our visit?
Yes, of course. What is it that brings you here?
We have reason to believe that enemies of Varlamore are operating within Cam Torum.
Enemies of Varlamore in Cam Torum? I couldn't even begin to imagine such a thing! Are you sure of this?
Very.
Then what can you tell me of these enemies?
They are members of the Twilight Emissaries cult. The cult wish to gain access to the Crypt of Tonali, but they require dwarven help to do so.
I assure you, no cultist would have been granted access to the city. For a start, there are only four of us who even have the ability to grant that access.
However, it is clear this is a matter of great importance to you. I will ensure that we keep a close eye out for any cultists.
With respect, Highlord, these cultists are our enemy. I would ask that you let us find and deal with them personally.
I understand, and I would very much like to help you. However, a human investigation in Cam Torum would not be looked upon kindly by the citizens here.
If I may, Highlord, the human travelling with the Queen here is a friend to us. They are the one who helped us deal with the issues in the ruins beneath the city.
If it is this human who is to be conducting the investigations here, I am sure they will act with discretion.
You are happy to vouch for them, Attala?
I am.
Very well. In that case, my good friends, I grant you permission to search for these cultists. Attala here will join you. Do let her know if there's anything at all that you need.
Thank you, Highlord.
Do not mention it. Dealing with Varlamorians is always such a pleasure. Now, I'm afraid I must depart, but I wish you good luck.
I will wait for you in the market,. I have some ideas for where you might begin your search.
So you've worked with the dwarves here before? You are full of surprises,.
I do my best.
Clearly. Now, time is of the essence here. Use the trust you have built with the dwarves to find and stop the cultists. Once you have done so, report to me at Tal Teklan in the Tlati Rainforest.
You're not staying?
No. My presence here will be a distraction, and I must ensure that the defences are ready at the Crypt of Tonali. However, I trust you will not let me down.
I will stay as well. It is possible my knowledge will come in useful during the investigation.
Nonsense. Need I remind you that you are still a target for the cultists? You will return to the palace.
The Emissaries hide everywhere. I am no safer at the palace than I am here.
Fine. But I will leave a bodyguard with you.
You should not waste the Kualti on me.
No I shouldn't, and yet here we are. Now, let us get to work. Good luck to you both, and may the sun light your way.
Thank you, my Queen. Come, let us meet with this dwarf in the market.
When I vouched for you back there, I wasn't expecting you to bring a Teokan with you.
He's here to help.
Hmph. Help with what exactly? You claim there are cultists in our city who want access this crypt of yours, but you haven't said why. What's so special about the crypt?
They think it hides a path to Mokhaiotl.
Ah, of course they do. Don't you humans ever tire of your fantasies?
Mokhaiotl is no fantasy!
Why? Have you been yourself?
Of course not! No human can reach Mokhaiotl!
Ha! And yet here you are trying to stop some cultists from doing just that!
Their beliefs are false! They follow the words of a lying heathen!
Ah, of course! A lying heathen. Just like us here, no doubt?
Okay, let's put a stop to this before things get out of hand. Attala, you said you had an idea for where we could start our search?
Hmph. As the Highlord said, there are only four dwarves who can grant humans access to Cam Torum. They are myself, the Highlord, Highseer Vandra, and Teumo, Vandra's advisor.
And you suspect someone?
Not exactly, but of those, Teumo is the most likely candidate. I trust the Highlord and the Highseer, and I know for a fact it wasn't me.
Let's start with Teumo then. Where can we find him?
His house is the one behind the bank, east of here. Let us meet there.
... and that he should be back soon. Why do you need to see him anyway, Attala? And how come you have a human priest with you?
Believe me, the priest wasn't my choice.
Excuse me!
Anyway, don't worry yourself, Galna. It's not an urgent matter by any means. It's just a little project that Teumo was working on that needs finishing off.
Speaking of which, do you mind if we take a look around while we wait for him? I imagine he'll have left some things from his project here.
Oh, I suppose so. Do keep out of the basement though. Teumo doesn't like people going down there.
He doesn't? Very well...
Is there anything we can get for you while we wait, Galna? Given we came barging in on you, it's the least we can do.
Oh, thank you, but I'm fine.
Not even a drink?
Very tempting, but I shouldn't really start drinking at this time...
If you're sure.
Nilsal, my child. Perhaps there is something here that can be of use to us. You should have a look around.
Will do.
Are you sure you wouldn't fancy a drink?
Well, I guess it would be rude to say no...
Thanks!
Thanks again for letting us look around, Galna.
Not at all! My home is yours. Go wherever you want!
Teumo must have had a reason for not wanting people down here. Let's find out what it is.
Interesting... Whatever you did caused the fire to go out...
So what's your take on this Mokhaiotl business?
Well, just so I'm understanding correctly, there's a cult who believe there is a path to the centre of the world?
And what do they intend to do once they get there?
They're claiming that two of the cultists are Ralos and Ranul reborn. They believe that once the two of them reach Mokhaiotl, the world will be destroyed and then remade once more.
Of course! What a totally normal thing to believe. Only humans would ever manage to reach this level of silliness.
Do not tar us all with the same brush. Most humans would never believe the nonsense those cultists spread.
No, you just believe a different nonsense. I must admit, to those of us who live in the real world, it can sometimes be hard to tell the difference.
Anyway, as for my take, your cultists are going to end up disappointed. There is no Mokhaiotl. The only path they will find is one leading to their deaths.
And yet, it isn't just them who have spoken of it.
What are you on about?
I encountered a nagua who called Mokhaiotl an archive.
Really? How curious... Hard to know what that might mean though. Nagua are not known for being reliable.
Ah, something we agree on.
So you don't think she was telling the truth?
The truth isn't something that ever seems to matter to your kind. This cult has already made up their minds on what they believe, just as your priest here has as well.
But I'm not asking them. I'm asking you. What do you believe?
That Ralos doesn't exist. That Ranul doesn't exist. That Mokhaiotl doesn't exist. It's as simple as that. Now, if that answer satisfies you, shall we get back to work?
I'll get to it.
Nilsal, my child. Perhaps there is something here that can be of use to us. You should have a look around and see what you can find.
Nilsal, my child. It looks like you're making progress. Keep at it.
If it's okay to ask, what's the deal with you and the Queen?
How do you mean, my child?
Well, you're Itzla's father and she's his mother, but the two of you don't seem too close.

We are incredibly close, for we are united in Ralos' light, and in the love we share for Itzla. However, it would be fair to say that our relationship is not a conventional one, especially to an outsider.
So how did it come about?
In times of old, the ruler of Varlamore would often unite with a Teokan of Ralos. His light guides us in all things, and a King or Queen will need that guidance more than most.
Before she took the throne, the Queen made the decision to revive that old tradition. I was more than happy to accept.
I see. Thanks for explaining.
Do not mention it, my child.
These dwarves sure love their drinks.
Must we wear these nasty things?
They're called disguises, brother.
We shouldn't have need to disguise ourselves. We shouldn't be here at all. This dwarf can't be trusted.
If you have any better suggestions, I'm all ears...
Ah, there you are. Oh, I'm sorry, am I meant to bow?
You jest, dwarf, but you should show some respect.
Yes, of course, Your... Holiness? Your Excellency? I'm sorry, I've never had the luck of meeting a god before. What is your preferred title?
Enough! Do not push me, dwarf!
Why? You are powerless to do anything about it. Without me, you go back to your Augur empty handed. I get the feeling she wouldn't like that.
Well then it's a good thing we do not answer to her.
No? If that's the case, then why are you doing her bidding? Of all the people she could have sent here, why did she pick her gods reborn?
The blood of Ralos flows through my veins, dwarf! When we reach Mokhaiotl, you will see for yourself.
Ha! And what will you see? What happens when you reach the apparent centre of the world, only to discover that everything you thought you knew, was wrong?
You think you're so...
Calm yourself, brother. Arguing gets us nowhere. Tell us, dwarf, can it be done?
Yes, I believe so. However, it will not be straightforward.
Meaning?
I will need you to retrieve something for me. The crypt doors are sealed using the magic of an Old One keystone. I will need one of these keystones for myself if I am to have any success.
And where will we find one of those?
It is a keystone that keeps the nagua imprisoned in Neypotzli. I'm sure it can't be the only one in there.
Then go in and find one for yourself. We do not serve you.
So you claim, and yet you don't actually have a choice. If you want my help, you'll find me a keystone.
You will have it. Just make sure you are ready.
Of course! I assume you've already sorted my payment?
Yes, as agreed.
Enjoy it while you can. That money won't mean anything once this is over.
Ah, truth be told, the money is just a bonus. The chance to be the one to show you fools the truth... That, my friends, is the real prize.
Anyway, best we all get to work. You have a keystone to find.
That didn't sound good. I'd better let Attala and Servius know.
You're back! Did you find something?
I did. You were right, Attala. Teumo is the one helping the cultists. He's sent them to Neypotzli to find something he calls an Old One keystone.
More trouble in Neypotzli? Great! This is just what we need!
What do we do?
Servius, go to Tal Teklan. If we can't stop them from getting that keystone, they'll have everything they need to enter the crypt. You need to make sure the Queen is ready.
I'll gather some guards and see if we can find Teumo. While I do that, you should go to Neypotzli and find the cultists.
Alright, let's get to it.
Good luck,. May the sun light your way.
Welcome back, iknil. You have timed your arrival here well, for Neypotzli is in danger once more. There are interlopers present who have little regard for the dangers posed by the Moons of Peril.
Well, that's exactly why I'm here. I know who these interlopers are and I know what they're after.
Yes, I suspected that to be the case. Your arrival was too precise to be coincidence. Tell me, what do the interlopers seek?
They're after an Old One keystone.
Old One? A curious term. We nagua measure time as the rivers change their paths and as the mountains errode away.
The days of the masters are fresh memories to me, but to you, one who is so short lived, they are days of myth...
Tell me, why do the interlopers seek the magic of the masters?
There's a crypt in the Tlati Rainforest, but it's sealed using Old One magic. These interlopers are cultists who want to get inside. They think they can do so if they have a keystone of their own.
Provided they have the aptitude, I suspect their beliefs are correct.
Then we need to stop them before they get one.
The icosahedron behind me is a form of keystone, and the interlopers have already tried to tamper with it.
But you stopped them?
Yes, but the danger remains. There is another keystone here. An earlier form of the icosahedron from when Neypotzli was being built.
However, the Moons of Peril must remain my priority. I cannot stop the interlopers from trying to obtain it.
Don't worry, I can deal with them. I just need to know where they are.
I can give you a fragment of the icosahedron. It resonates with the magic of the other keystone. It will guide you to it. Go to the keystone, and you will no doubt find the interlopers.
Thank you, but before I go, there's one other thing...
What is it?
The reason these cultists want to enter that crypt... It's because they think there's a path to Mokhaiotl inside.
Mokhaiotl?
Do you know what it is?
The masters were always secretive, especially towards the end. They rarely spoke of the world outside this place, but when they did, they only spoke of pain.
They had already lost so much by the time they summoned me. Their extinction was already guaranteed, yet they kept going all the same.
This word... Mokhaiotl... I only heard it once, when things neared the end. It was not clear to me what it was, but when they spoke of it... it was the first time I'd heard them speak with hope.
Now, I must return to my focus on the Moons of Peril. Seek me out in the chamber to the south east if you need my guidance. Go with haste, iknil. Good luck.
Yes, iknil?
How does this fragment work?
It resonates with the magic of the other keystone. It will guide you to it. You must go there and find the interlopers. They must be removed from Neypotzli.
Alright, I'll get to it.
Good luck, iknil.
Well, look who's here! It's Itzla's little lapdog!
Call me what you want, but the fun's over. You're not going anywhere with that keystone.
Call her in.
Metzli!
Ah, the outsider. I see you survived your encounter with the nagua.
It will take more than that to kill me.
Clearly. It's a shame you've chosen to fight against the truth. One such as yourself would have served us well.
Still, no matter. The Final Dawn will soon be upon us, and it will see us all become equal in servitude to our gods.
You two, guide this one to Mictl. Be sure not to underestimate.
*sigh* Alright, let's get this over with...
There you are,. That nagua told us how to find you.
Well, I'm sorry to say you missed the fun. They got away, Attala. I wasn't able to stop them in time.
I see. That's not the only bad news, I'm afraid. We searched the whole city, but couldn't find any trace of Teumo. My guess is he's already left to go join those cultists.
Meaning they now have everything they need to enter the crypt.
Sounds like you should head to Tal Teklan and report to your Queen then.
Before I go, Attala, I'm guessing we shouldn't expect any help from Cam Torum?
You know as well as I do, these cultists are fools. There is no world ending threat here, nor any threat to Cam Torum. This is a human problem. It's for humans to deal with.
I suspected as much.
If it's any consolation, I hope you don't die. You're one of the few humans that I don't tire of interacting with. Now, I'd better go report to the Highlord.
! Thank Ralos you're here!
What is it?
The Crypt of Tonali is under attack! The Queen has already gone to help. You should go yourself at once!
I'll head there right away!
The crypt is impossible to miss. It's beneath the large temple south east of here. Go, my child! Go with the strength of Ralos!
, you must go to the Crypt of Tonali and help with the defence. It's beneath the large temple south east of here.
Go with the strength of Ralos, my child!
Hold the line! We must not let them get to those doors!
Adventurer, about time you showed up! Hold them back! If we let too many defenders fall, nothing will stop those cultists getting through!
Watch out! More are coming!
Do not let them through!
It's time!
Mother...
Get him to safety! Ensure he's unharmed!
Now, let's get after them!
She's gone, Ennius! Don't you see? We've been abandoned!
She would not abandon us! We are her gods!
Gods?! My dear brother, how are you this much of a fool?
Don't tell me now that you deny our destiny?! After all that we've done... you now decide that you don't believe?
Now? Ennius, I never believed!
Then what was it all for?!
Yes, Furia, what was it for? You betrayed your people. You betrayed your Queen. Why?
Why? Because it was you who betrayed your people! You destroyed everything we stood for when you decided to open our kingdom! You are not worthy of the throne!
So Metzli promised the throne to you instead? Is that it? Seems like that's not going so well.
You lied to me, Furia!
I was creating a future for us, brother!
And now that future is at an end. Come quietly. Metzli has abandoned you. You have nowhere left to run.
So you can parade us in front of the people before you put us out of our misery? No. This ends here.
Ennius...
So be it. Kill them both.
Such a waste.
What happened to Furia?
Forgive me, my Queen. She was injured, but she managed to escape down into the caverns.
And Metzli's still down there as well. This isn't over yet.
My Queen.
Itzla? What are you doing here? Why aren't you resting?
I heard Metzli got away. I'm here to help.
Absolutely not!
Mother... This is my burden to bear. Let me finish this.
We've only just got you back, and you want me to send you after her?
You were going to go yourself, even though they need you up here. Why you and not me?
That's...
*sigh*
, keep my fool of a son alive, would you?
I'll do my best.
Go, the both of you, before I change my mind.
Thank you, my Queen.
Itzla......
Be careful down there. May the sun light your way.
Can you believe this place was down here all this time? We had no idea!
You never knew all this was right underneath one of your holy sites?

Well... sort of, I suppose. We always knew the crypt was originally built by the Old Ones, but we had no idea how far all of this stretched. It's not like anyone was ever allowed to come down here and check!
Anyway, there hasn't been any sign of Metzli or Furia, but they must have come this way. Let's have a look around and see if we can find a way forward.
Any thoughts on where to start?
Well, we seem to have more of these strange teleport tiles here... Maybe we should see where they lead?
We're making progress. Let's keep it up.
What should we do now?
Well, we managed to activate a statue in one of these rooms. My guess is we now need to activate the one in the other.
This room is fascinating...
I think we're making progress,.
Any ideas on what to do?

Well, we've got another one of those statues, and these altars around the edges also look important. The layout of the room seems quite specific as well. It's almost like a compass, or maybe even a clock!
A clock? But there's only eight points.
True, but maybe the Old Ones used a different kind of clock to us...
Hmm...
Well, this thing we're doing with the altars seems to be working, so I say we just keep doing that.
Of course, iknami! What do you need translating?
Oma? I think that means two.
Naui? This is the one I struggle with. It might mean four.
Kuli? I think that means five.
Chaki? I think that means six.
Koma? I think that means seven.
Ueai? I think that means eight.
Makti? I think that means ten.
Hmm... I'm not too sure on that one.
Very funny,.
Thanks! Could you translate another?
I'll give it a go.
Thanks! I'm done translating for now.
Hopefully it helps in some way, iknami.
What do you make of this essence I found?
Hmm... It looks similar to the altars around the room. Where did you find it?
In these urns scattered around.
Well, I doubt it was left here by accident...
Ah, the teleporter seems to have separated us.
What now?
Well, I might still be able to be of use from here. These look like pressure plates. I might be able to use them to help you in some way.
Any idea what that 'some way' might be?
I'm not really sure. Those braziers around the room look like they could be important though.
Alright, I'll see if I can work something out.
Any idea what we should be doing here?
Well it seems I can use these pressure plates to help you get past the fires. Beyond that, I'm not too sure. Those braziers around the room look like they could be important though.
We seem to be making progress,. Keep it up.
I'm already there,.
What do you think we'll find on the other side?
If all goes well, we find Metzli and Furia and we show them the error of their ways. No doubt they won't be willing to hear reason, so I suspect it will get a touch violent in the process...
But then, once that's done, maybe we go and have a nice drink somewhere. I know I need one.
A drink does sound nice, it's just...
What is it?
That nagua... I keep thinking about what she said about Mokhaiotl being an archive. What does that mean? Could this place be what she was referring to?
Hmm... Well, I guess there's only one way to find out... Shall we?
When you're ready,.
They can't be too far ahead now. Let's find them,.
This ends here, Metzli. No more running.
Running? What do you think I'm running from? After all this time, I'm finally right where I need to be.
And where's that exactly? Another Old One ruin? That's all this place is. There's no centre of the world here. Face it, Metzli, you've failed. Your Final Dawn has failed.
The Final Dawn? Don't you see? There never was a Final Dawn. There never will be a Final Dawn.
You lied to the Emissaries? Why?
Why? Quite simply because they let me.
You're mad!
Mad? Of course I'm mad! So many see madness as a weakness... As a burden. But to do what I do... To seek what I seek... Insanity is the only way one can ever walk that path.
The people of this land... Their lives are built upon the truths presented to them. Ralos... Ranul... They put their faith in the gods they are told to believe in.
From their first cries to their dying breaths, every choice they make is built upon those foundations. Foundations that have become so ingrained, that no sane person would ever question them.
You have some, like the Emissaries, who dance on the edge of madness, but never leap into its embrace.
It was never truth that they sought. They just took comfort in someone telling them what they wanted to hear.
And so it falls to me. We stand here in Mokhaiotl, the last archive of the Old Ones. When their doom befell them, they did not pray, they preserved.
They housed their collective knowledge, their collective power, right here. For years it's sat waiting... Waiting for a worthy inheritor. Waiting... for me.

Here, today, I will shatter the foundations that the sane never question. I will uncover the realities they shy away from. And in my madness, I will finally deliver that which the world has forgotten.
Today, I will be the one to finally find the truth.
Time to finish this.
It's over, Metzli. Surrender.
Never! I've fought too hard for this!
Look around, Metzli. This place is empty. Whatever 'truth' you're looking for, it's clearly not here.
No! I won't let you stop me now!
She's injured. She won't be going far. Let's get after her.
Metzli won't get far now she's injured. Let's find her.
There's... nothing here.
Of course there's nothing here, Metzli. What were you expecting? Did you think Ralos himself was going to pop out and share the secrets of the world with you?
But the Old Ones... This was their archive... Their gift...
And yet it's empty. Perhaps this 'gift' was never meant for us. Or maybe it never existed at all. Either way, there's no 'truth' to be found here. Looks like we'll just have to keep making our own.
Metzli, you traitor!
Furia... It's over.
Over? No...
Now it's over.
Well... I suppose that's that then.
What do we do now?
We'd better take Furia here to my mother. She'll be the one who decides what happens to her.
Furia, come with us, and don't even think about trying anything.
Are you coming, ?
You go on ahead. I want to take a look around first. I'll catch up with you.
Fair enough. Don't take too long.
Ah, there you are,.
So it's done?
It's done. Metzli is dead. This one here is all that remains.
Take her to the capital. Find a nice cell for her where she can await her fate.
If I may, mother... Metzli and Ennius are already dead. The Emissaries are now without leaders and are unlikely to be much of a threat.
But?
But there are still many out there who supported them. As far as they're concerned, we've already made two martyrs today. It might be prudent for us to keep Furia alive.
I see...
My son is showing a remarkable amount of restraint and foresight. The cultists didn't replace him with an imposter, did they?
No, I think it's definitely him.
Then consider me impressed. We might make a king out of you yet.
Now, I must return to the capital. I need to see to arrangements around a new Teokan.. Itzla. Well done. Timoiva for now, and may the sun light your way.
Well, that was quite the adventure.
Yes, nice of you to show up right at the end. Trust you to skip all the hard work.
Tetamo! I was working very hard, thank you very much. I was conducting essential research on our enemy from the last place they'd expect!
Is that so? Well, I'm sure you made many useful discoveries.
Indeed I did, iknami. Speaking of which, did you discover anything of note down in the ruins?
Yes and no. It seems Metzli was right in a way. Mokhaiotl was meant to be an Old One archive. Thing is, they never finished it. Something killed the ones working on it while it was still being built.
Interesting... All this time we've thought of Mokhaiotl as the centre of the world, and yet it was something else entirely. Makes you wonder what else it is that we don't know...
Still, I guess it doesn't really matter. Metzli fooled herself into thinking that she could find all the answers, yet the beauty of this world is that we are free to look upon it as we desire.
But enough about Metzli. I have something far more important to talk about.
While I know you of course needed no convincing to put your life at risk to rescue me, it feels only right to show my thanks by giving you a little something.
Ah, but I see you don't have space for it right now. Come back when you do.
This blade once belonged to my grandfather, but I believe its path now lies with you.
But Itzla, that's your sword!
And I can't think of anyone more deserving to wield it, iknami. Now, I'd best return to the palace. Timoiva, my friend, and may the sun light your way.
Nilsal,. As I was saying, it feels only right for me to show my thanks to you by giving you a little something.
Hey, Itzla.
Nilsal,.
How are you doing?
Well, now that the local cult of murderers is no longer trying to kill me or my father, I'd say things are looking up.
I'm also finding I've got a bit more time on my hands now that things are all sorted. I suggested to mother I spend that time in the Colosseum. I don't know if she was totally convinced.
I can't imagine why...
Anyway, I won't keep you, iknami. I'm sure you've got plenty more adventures to go on. Timoiva, my friend.
You don't happen to have another sword do you?
Well, iknami, as luck would have it, someone came along trying to sell a sword that perfectly matches the one I gave you. He claimed he just found it on the ground!
How odd...
Indeed. I'm sure it can't be the same one. After all, that was a one of a kind family heirloom, so you'd definitely have taken good care of it.
Yeah... definitely...
Anyway, I had to pay 250,000 coins to buy this one, so if you want it, that's how much I'll have to charge you.
Ah, I don't have enough. I'll be back shortly.
Sounds good to me.
Use it well, iknami.
I think I'll pass.
As you wish, iknami.
I'm afraid not, iknami. You'll have to go and find where you left the one I gave you. I'm sure you won't have lost it. After it, it's a one of a kind family heirloom.
Right... yes... I'll go see if I can find it.
I'd better get going.
Timoiva, my friend.
Nilsal,. It is good to see you.
Likewise, my Queen. How have things been since the Emissaries were dealt with?
Well, with the cult out of the way, we've been able to refocus on the recent opening of the kingdom. Signing the treaties was only the first step.
There are new opportunities for us in areas such as trade that we're still yet to fully explore.
Then of course you have Kourend. The complicated history between our kingdoms means we are yet to sign a treaty with them, but my hope is that will change soon.
Then of course you have Kourend. The complicated history between our kingdoms means we are yet to sign a treaty with them.
I was hoping to arrange one with their new king, but his reign turned out to be a rather short one. I must confess, I find the continued instability up there to be concerning.
You're not the only one...
We will have to see how their new king fares. He is young and inexperienced, but he may still have potential...
Anyway, if there's nothing else, I'm afraid I must return to my work. May the sun light your way,.
Nilsal, my child. It is good to see you.
Likewise, Servius. How are things?
Well, it is relieving to know that my life is no longer in danger, but there is no shortage of work to be done.
The Sect of Ranul are planning a special Gathering to select their new Teokan, and we in the Church of Ralos have an important part to play. There is a lot to prepare.
Given what happened in the crypt, I'm guessing things will be a bit different this time as well.
Indeed. For a start, the doors within the crypt seem to be beyond repair, meaning the ceremony will need some substantial changes.
It does also mean that anyone can now access the caverns below, which reminds me, Itzla told me what you found down there.
Yes, Mokhaiotl. Not quite the centre of the world after all.
Well, I'd be careful of making assumptions, my child. Itzla said the ruins were meant to be an archive. A centre point for all the knowledge of the Old Ones.
I'd say it makes perfect sense that they'd choose to name a place like that after Mokhaiotl.
I suppose I hadn't considered that possibility.
Well, being the Teokan of Ralos, I do have the odd moment of wisdom from time to time. Now, I must get back to my work. Timoiva, my child, and may the sun light your way.
Furia?
Hello there,. I hear that cultist business of yours ended up getting sorted. Your Queen traded Teumo with the Highlord in return for a new mineral deal.
On that topic, I'm going to guess that they didn't end up finding the centre of the world?
Not exactly, though they did find something. It seems that Mokhaiotl was actually meant to be an Old One archive, though it was never finished.
Ah, so once again you humans managed to misinterpret something the Old Ones left behind. Some things never change.
Anyway, was there something you wanted?
Hello there,. What can I do for you?
How are things?
Well, things were quiet for a while, but then you dug up that Teumo business. The Highlord and the Highseer were both rather unhappy. The Highseer in particular. She now needs to find a new advisor.
Still, at least the world didn't end. Hard to imagine that some of you humans actually considered that a possibility! Your kind never change.
Welcome back, iknil. Were you able to deal with those interlopers?
Yes. They won't be a problem again.
That is good to hear. The Moons of Peril already pose so great a threat. Neypotzli does not need any more dangers.
I thought you'd want to know as well that they did find Mokhaiotl. It turns out it was meant to be an archive.
An archive?
Somewhere to house the collective knowledge of the Old Ones. Thing is, it was never finished. Something happened that stopped them from doing so.
I see... The masters always hoped that humans and dwarves would be their inheritors. Mokhaiotl must have been part of that. To hear that it never came to be is... unfortunate.
I'm sorry, Eyatlalli.
It is alright, iknil. Time is like a river. You can try to change the current, but in the end, it always reaches the sea. Some things are simply not meant to be.
Now, let us speak of something else.
I wanted to ask you about your masters.
What do you wish to know?
I guess anything really. I still know so little about them.
If your hope is that I can tell you about a whole race, then I am likely to disappoint you, iknil. The masters were secretive individuals. They rarely divulged information that I did not require.
All I can tell you about are the three individuals that I knew personally.
That's still something. What were they like?
They were kind, but filled with sadness. As you know, they summoned me after another of their kind unleashed the Moons of Peril.
It was a dark time. Their people had suffered great calamity years earlier and their extinction was inevitable.
It seems that many, such as the shaman who summoned the Moons, felt that the only salvation left was destruction.
My masters, however, felt differently. They fought for a world that was no longer their own. They believed in preserving these lands for those who would inhabit them afterwards.
Us?
Yes. Humans and dwarves were recent arrivals here, but the masters saw you as inheritors. I believe in some ways, you offered them hope in a time filled with pain.
I see. Than you for sharing that with me.
It is not a problem, iknil.
Another group left earlier. Without the Augur to guide them, they are lost.
The Augur may be gone, but we remain. We must stay true to her teachings.
I can't believe the Augur is gone. I really thought she would lead us to the Final Dawn.
We become more fractured by the day. Earlier I heard someone claiming that Ennius and Furia weren't actually Ralos and Ranul reborn at all!
